revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

__TOC__ ==General Information== Slayer armor will reduce hit and spell damage by 50% as well as grant 75% spell poison resist chance. The chance of getting this bonus is scaled by the number of slayer pieces you have for that particular foe (e.g. if you have 2 pieces out of 6, then you only have a 33% chance of getting this 50% damage reduction). When you are hit by the corresponding slayer monster, a flash/sound occurs on your character, similar to using a slayer weapon. To further explain the damage mitigation the following shall apply. Assume you were hit by a Flamestrike that did 40HP damage a full slayer suit would remove 50% of that damage making that Flamestrike do 20HP instead. If you were to have resisted that Flamestrike, from magic resist, then you would be hit for 20HP and the slayer armor would remove 50% making the spell do 10HP damage. This mitigation can be further reduced by the use of the Phylactery of Resilience which is one of the [[Meta Talismans]]. Also the use of a [[Tameables#Swamp_Dragon|Swamp Dragon]] will provide even more stacked benefit. In a perfect scenario with a max resilience talisman, exception swamp dragon, and full slayer suit you will only take 20% of the total 100% incoming damage. ==How do I make it?== Thanks to the knowledgeable researcher Blaine the Gypsy, we have the following information... Slayer armor can be created by placing glowing runes in a specific order inside a [[Crystal Workbench]]. So first you will need to acquire a crystal workbench. The crystal workbench is created from crystals mined in a [[Random Dungeon Adventure]]. The crystals require 120 [[Mining]] skill to mine. It is not known at this time if mining gloves can be used as a buff to mine the crystals. Each crystal that is mined will provide one set of crystal shards used to create the workbench. After 10 shards, you will be able to craft a Crystal Workbench using the [[Tinkering]] crafting skill. The work bench can then be locked down in a house and used to create your slayer armor. File:TheWorkbench1.PNG|The Workbench File:Workbench1.PNG|Workbench Gump File:CrystalWorkbench1.jpg|Crystals to Mine File:CrystalShard1.PNG|Crystals Shards File:CrystalWorkBenchTinkering1.png|Tinkering Menu File:CrystalWorkBenchTinkering2.png|Tinkering Materials Once you have acquired a crystal workbench then you will be able to utilize glowing runes with the workbench. So start farming those glowing runes! Any type of gargoyle kin will have a chance to drop glowing runes, but there are other monsters in the world that have dropped runes as well. Example, glowing runes can also be obtained from Monsters in a [[Random Dungeon Adventure]]. Each glowing rune represents a letter from the gargoyle alphabet and using the recipes described above will tell you what order you should put the glowing runes inside the Crystal Workbench. You will be able to click on runes to see "which rune" they are as they have a description of the letter they represent. Also the addition of the [[Slayer_Armor#Glowing_Rune_Reliquary|Rune Reliquary]], described below, really helps greatly to organize and pull runes out for later use. File:GlowingRunes1.PNG|Example of Glowing Rune File:GargishAlphabet.png|Gargish Alphabet File:SlayerArmor5.jpg|Example Armor After the glowing runes have been placed in the correct order inside the Crystal Workbench, hit the 'imbue' button and click a piece of armor. You can imbue ANY existing armor (excluding blessed pieces) with a slayer property so it is best to imbue the best possible pieces of armor. '''If the runes are placed in INCORRECT ORDER or NOT SPELLED CORRECTLY then YOU AND YOUR ITEM will both be DESTROYED.''' File:Benchdeath.gif|'''Workbench Death'''

[[Slayer_Types#Snakes_Bane|Snakes Bane]] | align="center" | Lesser Slayer | align="center" | N, R, A |} ==Double Slayer== Now lets say you're going to your super secret farming spot that no PKs know about but the only problem is there are different types of Monsters there. No problem! You can put 2 slayer properties on ONE piece of armor! Check it out: [[File:SlayerArmor6.png]] ==Glowing Rune Reliquary== To make it easier to collect and pick out the appropriate runes, you can purchase a Glowing Rune Reliquary from Sasha the Unique Wares Vendor near West Britain Bank. It costs 250,000 gold pieces and holds up to 50 of each rune. A real time saver! The chest has to be locked down in your house to be used. You can drop runes on it individually or drop a bag of runes on it and it will scoop them up and sort them for you. When you double-click the chest, you will be presented with a menu showing you how many of each rune you have. Each entry has an arrow next to it to allow you to take out one rune. File:Glowingrunechestgoldsink.png|Where to buy File:Runechestlist.png|Chest menu ==Transmutation Cube== The Transmutation Cube was added to the gold sink vendor at the price of 200k gold. This cube provides a way to use some of the lesser used glowing runes to create runes you want instead. There are two options for creating new glowing runes. File:TransmuteCube1.PNG|Where to buy The first is creating a random new rune by placing only '''TWO''' random runes into the cube and hitting '''transmute'''. File:TransmuteCube2.PNG|Random New Rune The second is creating a rune of your choice by placing only '''FIVE''' random runes into the cube and hitting '''transmute'''. File:TransmuteCube4.PNG|Rune of your Choice File:TransmuteCube5.PNG|Selection Menu ==Old Slayer Armor History== A Gargoyle Alchemist used to drop recipes that would tell you what order the glowing runes would need to be placed in. These monsters no longer spawn in the world. There are two types of Crystal Workbench. An old Pre-Patch workbench which cannot apply Silver recipe ("nechra"). At this time there are very few of these even remaining. Typically the only Pre-Patch workbench you may encounter would come as an IDOC loot drop from a very old house. You will need to contact a Game Master using the Help menu to get the workbench patched. There are two ways to tell it is an old workbench, the old gump below and that it is unable to apply silver "nechra". File:SlayerArmor1.jpg|Old Workbench Gump File:SlayerArmor2.jpg|Old Research Document [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Crafting]]
